gurmukhi: qw qy qumhUM cMf kI syv krhu icqu lwie ] jIqn ko bru dyiegI Air qb lIjhu Gwie ]1325]
transliteration: Taa Te Toumhoon Channd Kisevaroh Chit(u) Laae|| Jitan Ko Bar(u) Deigiar(i) Tab Leejoh Ghaae(i)||1325||
translation: “Therefore you should also serve Chandi single-mindedly, which she will bestow the boon of victory and then you will be able to kill the enemy.1325.

gurmukhi: jwgq jw kI joiq jg jl Ql rhI smwie ] bHm ibSn hir rUp mY qiRguin rhI Thrwie ]1326]
transliteration: Jaagad Jaa Kijot(i) Jag Jal Thal Rahisamaae|| Brahm Bishan Har(i) Roop Mai Trigoun(i) Rahithahraae||1326||
translation: “He, whose gleaming light pervades in water, on plain and the whole world, the same is preset in Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva in the form of three modes.1326.

gurmukhi: jw kI klw brqY jg mY Aru jw kI klw sB rUpn mY ] Aru jw kI klw ibmlw hir ky kmlwpiq ky kmlw qn mY ]
transliteration: Jaa Kikalaa Bartai Jag Mai Ar(u) Jaa Kikalaa Sabh Roopan Mai|| Ar(u) Jaa Kikalaa Bimlaa Har(i) Ke Kamlaapat(i0 Ke Kamlaa Tan Mai||
translation: “He, whose power is present in the whole world and in all forms, whose power is present in Parvati, Vishnu and Lakshsmi,

gurmukhi: puin jw kI klw igr rUKn mY sis pUKn mY mGvw Gn mY ] qumhUM nhI jwnI BvwnI klw jg mwnI ko DXwn kro mn mY ]1327]
transliteration: Poun(i) Jaa Kikalaa Gir Rookhan Mai Sas(i) Pookhan Mai Maghvaa Ghan Mai|| Toumhoon Nahijaanibhavaanikalaa Jag Maaniko Dhyaan Daro Man Mai||1327||
translation: “And whose power is present in the mountain, tree, sun, moon, Indra and clouds also; you have not adored that Bhavani, therefore now meditate on her.1327.

gurmukhi: skiq isMG br skiq so mwNg lXo Bgvwn ] qwhI ky prswid qy rn jIqq nhI hwn ]1328]
transliteration: Sakat(i) Singh Bar Sakat(i) So Maan Layo Bhagvaan|| Taahike Parsaadh Te Ran Jeetat Nahihaan||1328||
translation: “Shakti Singh has with his austerities, obtained the boon from the Lord and through His Grace, he is winning the war and he is not losing anything.1328.

gurmukhi: iSv sUrj ss scIpiq bHm ibSn sur koie ] jo ieh so irs kY lrY jIq n jYhY soie ]1329]
transliteration: Shiv Sooraj Sas Sacheepat(i) Brahm Bishan Sur Koe|| Jo Ih So Ris Kai Darai Jeet Na Jaihai Soe||1329||
translation: “If any of the gods like Shiva, sun, moon, Indra, Brahma, Vishnu or any other wages the war with him, he will not be able to conquer him.1329.

gurmukhi: jau hir Awie iBrY ieh so nhI dyKq hoN blu hY iqn mo ] cqurwnn Aaur KVwnn ibSn Gno bl hY su khXo ijn mo ]
transliteration: Jau Har(i) Aae Bhirat Ih So Nahidekhat Hon Bal(u) Hai Tin Mo|| Chaturaanan Aur Khadaanan Bishan Ghano Bal Hai Su Kahyo Jin Mo||
translation: “If the god Shiva fights with him, he also does not have so much strength so as to victorious over him; Brahma, Kartikeya, Vishnu etc.

gurmukhi: puin BUq ipswc surwidk jy Asurwidk hY gnqI ikn mo ] jdubIr khXo sB bIrn so su ieqo bl BUp DrY ien mo ]1330]
transliteration: Poun(i) Bhool Pisaach Suraadik Je Asuraadik Hai Gadtikin Mo Jadoubeer Kahyo Sabh Bderan So Su Ito Bal Bhoop Ddarai In Mo||1330||
translation: “Who are considered very powerful and the ghosts, fiends gods and demons etc. are all powerless aginst him;” Then Krishna said to all the Yadavas, “This king has so much power.”1330.
